searchDocs.title: First Blog Post
searchDocs.content: Welcome to the uni-tel API Documentation site

searchDocs.title: CSTA Specification​
searchDocs.content: Link to the CSTA Standard.

searchDocs.title: Use cases​
searchDocs.content: From a CRM system, a button click makes a call to a contact. Written in JavaScript/frontend using SignalR.From a CRM system, a button click makes a call to a contact. Written in .NET C#/backend using SignalR.A Web app that implements a PBX.

searchDocs.title: The Basics​
searchDocs.content: If you are completely new to CSTA, here is a very short introduction:  Setup listeners on each type of event you want to receive. MonitorStartedEvent, DeliveredEvent, EstablishedEvent and ConnectionClearedEvent covers the basics.Request to monitor specific devices via MonitorStart or the entire trunk via MonitorTrunk.Request a new call via MakeCall.Request to end the call via ClearConnection.You've now made a basic setup and made your first call!

searchDocs.title: Requests​
searchDocs.content: The CSTA Standard supports many different requests. It can be a request for an action against a device or for the CSTA API itself.  Login and Monitoring Requests​  Request	DescriptionStartApplicationSession	Used to log in and authenticate incoming client connection. MonitorStart	Used to inform the API that the client wishes to receive CSTA events for the given device. MonitorTrunk	Used to inform the API that the client wishes to receive CSTA events on a given trunk.  Call Requests​  Request	DescriptionMakeCall	Requesting a call to be made between to devices. ConsultationCall	Requesting an attended transfer to another device. ReconnectCall	Requesting to cancel the attended transfer currently in progress. DirectedPickupCall	Requesting to pickup a call from another ringing device. SingleStepTransferCall	Requesting a blind transfer to another device. ClearConnection	Terminate the call on a given device or queue.  State Requests​  Request	DescriptionSnapShotDevice	Returns the state of the requested device. GetDoNotDisturb	Returns Do-Not-Disturb of the requested device. SetDoNotDisturb	Updates Do-Not-Disturb on the requested device. GetForwarding	Returns the current Forwarding rules of the requested device. SetForwarding	Updates the Forwarding rules on the requested device. GetQueue	Returns the queue name on the requested queue. GetQueueMember	Returns all queue members on the requested queue. SetQueueMember	Updates a specific queue member on a queue

searchDocs.title: Events​
searchDocs.content: The CSTA Standard supports many different events. Events inform the client on state changes on devices or queues.  Event	Related to	DescriptionMonitorStartedEvent	Devices, Queues	Fired when monitoring of a device or queue has been registered in the system. ConnectionClearedEvent	Devices, Queues	Fired when a call has been terminated for the given device or queue. DeliveredEvent	Devices, Queues	Fired when a call has been delivered to a device or queue. EstablishedEvent	Devices	Fired when a call has been established on the given device. TransferedEvent	Devices	Fired when a call has been established on the given device. DoNotDisturbEvent	Devices	Fired when Do-Not-Disturb has been updated on a given device in the system. ForwardingEvent	Devices	Fired when Forwarding has been updated on a given device in the system. QueueMemberEvent	Queues	Fired when a queue member has been updated on a given queue in the system. QueueAddedEvent	Queues	Fired when a queue has been added on a given trunk in the system. QueueRemovedEvent	Queues	Fired when a queue has been removed from a given trunk in the system.

searchDocs.title: StartApplicationSession
searchDocs.content: StartApplicationSession Send TCP string: StartApplicationSession request <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?> <StartApplicationSession> <applicationInfo> <applicationSpecificInfo> <vendorData:userID>bill@uni-tel.dk</vendorData:userID> <vendorData:password>*******<vendorData:password> <vendorData:pbxDomain>22334455.pbx.one-connect.dk</vendorData:pbxDomain> </applicationSpecificInfo> </applicationInfo> <requestedSessionDuration>120</requestedSessionDuration> </StartApplicationSession> Wait for a response: StartApplicationSessionPosResponse <StartApplicationSessionPosResponse xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <sessionID>HotFShcrHZWUfc6tMIjD0A</sessionID> <actualProtocolVersion>http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6</actualProtocolVersion> <actualSessionDuration>120</actualSessionDuration> </StartApplicationSessionPosResponse>

searchDocs.title: Call functionality
searchDocs.content: Call functionality This section outlines the possible requests related to calls AnswerCallMakeCall

searchDocs.title: How to use​
searchDocs.content: tip The TCP client support XML requests, responses and events. They follow the CSTA format in the ECMA-323 CSTA Standard.  Open a TCP socket.Authentication: Login by sending a CSTA StartApplicationSession request in XML format (as a string) to the socket.CSTA request, responses and CSTA events are received as strings from the TCP socket. You need to split up the received text into XML document strings and then deserialized into a typed object if needed.

searchDocs.title: .NET sample client​
searchDocs.content: The C# sample client is written for .NET Core 6 using the NetCoreServer library available at nuget.  public class TcpClient : NetCoreServer.TcpClient { private const string MESSAGE_TERMINATOR = "\0"; private readonly Action<object> _newMessageFunc; private readonly Serializer _serializer; private string _dataReceived = string.Empty; public TcpClient(Action<object> newMessageFunc, string address, int port) : base(address, port) { _newMessageFunc = newMessageFunc; _serializer = new Serializer(); } public void SendAsync<T>(T message) { Console.WriteLine($"Sending {message.GetType()} message "); base.SendAsync(_serializer.Serialize(message) + MESSAGE_TERMINATOR); } protected override void OnConnected() { Console.WriteLine($"TcpClient connected"); ReceiveAsync(); base.OnConnected(); } protected override void OnDisconnected() { Console.WriteLine($"TcpClient disconnected"); base.OnDisconnected(); } protected override void OnReceived(byte[] buffer, long offset, long size) { var chunk = Encoding.UTF8.GetString(buffer, (int)offset, (int)size); _dataReceived += chunk; while (_dataReceived.Contains(MESSAGE_TERMINATOR)) { var index = _dataReceived.IndexOf(MESSAGE_TERMINATOR, StringComparison.Ordinal); var message = _dataReceived.Substring(0, index); _dataReceived = _dataReceived.Substring(index + 1); try { var convertedMessage = _serializer.Deserialize(message); _newMessageFunc(convertedMessage); } catch (Exception ex) { Console.WriteLine($"Invalid XML document? Exception: {ex.Message}. XML = {message}"); } } } protected override void OnError(SocketError error) { Console.WriteLine($"TCP client returned error code: '{error}'"); }

searchDocs.title: Example XML requests​
searchDocs.content: This example connects to the CSTA server and then sends a MakeCall request. Local number 200 calls 22334455.  Send TCP string:

searchDocs.title: Get access to uni-tel CSTA TCP API​
searchDocs.content: If you want to know more, feel free to contact us here. The contact form is in Danish only, but inquiries in English are most welcome.

searchDocs.title: AnswerCall request​
searchDocs.content: AnswerCall request <AnswerCall> <callToBeAnswered> <callID>SIP/hpbx-00000247</callID> <deviceID>200</deviceID> </callToBeAnswered> <privateData> <requestID>137-4cf6576b-bdbf-44b4-9503-adb52da4da2a</requestID> </privateData> </AnswerCall>

searchDocs.title: AnswerCallResponse​
searchDocs.content: The response looks like this:  AnswerCallResponse <AnswerCallResponse xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <answeredConnection> <callID>SIP/hpbx-00000247</callID> <deviceID>200</deviceID> </answeredConnection> <privateData> <requestID>137-4cf6576b-bdbf-44b4-9503-adb52da4da2a</requestID> </privateData> </AnswerCallResponse>

searchDocs.title: Events
searchDocs.content: Events This section outlines the possible events DoNotDisturbEventQueueMemberEvent

searchDocs.title: MakeCall request​
searchDocs.content: MakeCall request <MakeCall> <callingDevice>200</callingDevice> <calledDirectoryNumber>22334455</calledDirectoryNumber> <autoOriginate>doNotPrompt</autoOriginate> <privateData> <requestID>155-a04dbfd1-ec67-4637-93b8-8248f13fe691</requestID> </privateData> </MakeCall>

searchDocs.title: MakeCallResponse​
searchDocs.content: The response looks like this:  MakeCallResponse <MakeCallResponse xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <privateData> <requestID>155-a04dbfd1-ec67-4637-93b8-8248f13fe691</requestID> </privateData> <callingDevice> <callID>N/A</callID> <deviceID>200</deviceID> </callingDevice> <callLinkageData> <globalCallData> <globalCallLinkageId>N/A</globalCallLinkageId> </globalCallData> </callLinkageData> </MakeCallResponse>

searchDocs.title: DoNotDisturbEvent
searchDocs.content: DoNotDisturbEvent This event is a result of DND status being updated on a user. It is also triggered when a user sets DND via the SetDoNotDisturb request. DoNotDisturbEvent <DoNotDisturbEvent xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <monitorCrossRefID>u-44220989-200</monitorCrossRefID> <device> <deviceIdentifier>200</deviceIdentifier> </device> <doNotDisturbOn>true</doNotDisturbOn> </DoNotDisturbEvent>

searchDocs.title: Monitoring
searchDocs.content: Monitoring This section outlines the possible monitor requests MonitorTrunkMonitorStart

searchDocs.title: QueueMemberEvent
searchDocs.content: QueueMemberEvent This event is a result of a queue member being updated in the system. It is also triggered when a user sets a queue member via the SetQueueMember request. QueueMemberEvent <QueueMemberEvent xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <monitorCrossRefID>q-12345678-400</monitorCrossRefID> <memberList> <memberListItem> <active>true</active> <activeSip>true</activeSip> <activeMobile>true</activeMobile> <activeSkype>true</activeSkype> <agentDN>200</agentDN> </memberListItem> </memberList> </QueueMemberEvent>

searchDocs.title: MonitorStart request​
searchDocs.content: Example:  MonitorStart request <MonitorStart xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <monitorObject> <deviceObject>u-12345678-200</deviceObject> </monitorObject> <privateData> <requestID>100-null</requestID> </privateData> </MonitorStart>

searchDocs.title: MonitorStartResponse​
searchDocs.content: A monitor start request will result in a MonitorStartResponse similar to the following:  MonitorStartResponse <MonitorStartResponse xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <monitorCrossRefID>u-12345678-200</monitorCrossRefID> <privateData> <monitoredConnection> <deviceID>200</deviceID> </monitoredConnection> <requestID>100-null</requestID> <monitorCount>0</monitorCount> </privateData> </MonitorStartResponse>

searchDocs.title: MonitorTrunk request​
searchDocs.content: MonitorTrunk request <MonitorTrunk xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <monitorObject> <deviceObject>1</deviceObject> </monitorObject> <privateData> <requestID>100-null</requestID> </privateData> </MonitorTrunk>

searchDocs.title: MonitorStartResponse​
searchDocs.content: A monitor trunk request will result in a MonitorStartResponse similar to the following:  MonitorStartResponse <MonitorStartResponse xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <monitorCrossRefID>12345678</monitorCrossRefID> <privateData> <monitoredConnection> <deviceID>12345678</deviceID> </monitoredConnection> <requestID>100-null</requestID> <monitorCount>63</monitorCount> </privateData> </MonitorStartResponse>

searchDocs.title: State
searchDocs.content: State This section outlines the possible state requests GetCallProfileGetDoNotDisturbGetForwardingGetQueueGetQueueMemberSetDoNotDisturbSetQueueMemberSnapShotDevice

searchDocs.title: GetDoNotDisturb request​
searchDocs.content: This requests asks for the DND status on a given user.  GetDoNotDisturb request <GetDoNotDisturb> <device>200</device> <privateData> <requestID>101-null</requestID> </privateData> </GetDoNotDisturb>

searchDocs.title: GetDoNotDisturbResponse​
searchDocs.content: The response returns the DND state of the user.  GetDoNotDisturbResponse <GetDoNotDisturbResponse xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <doNotDisturbOn>false</doNotDisturbOn> <privateData> <requestID>101-null</requestID> </privateData> </GetDoNotDisturbResponse>

searchDocs.title: GetCallProfile request​
searchDocs.content: Requests the call profile on a given user.  GetCallProfile request <GetCallProfile> <device>200</device> <privateData> <requestID>101-null</requestID> </privateData> </GetCallProfile>

searchDocs.title: GetCallProfileResponse​
searchDocs.content: Returns the current call profile of the requested user.  GetCallProfileResponse <GetCallProfileResponse xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <callProfile> <outgoingNumberPresentation> <localNumberPresentation> <numberType>None</numberType> <number /> </localNumberPresentation> <mobileNumberPresentation> <numberType>None</numberType> <number /> </mobileNumberPresentation> <teamsNumberPresentation> <numberType>None</numberType> <number /> </teamsNumberPresentation> </outgoingNumberPresentation> <incomingCallMatrix> <localDevice> <local>true</local> <mobile>true</mobile> <teams>false</teams> </localDevice> <mobileDevice> <local>false</local> <mobile>true</mobile> <teams>false</teams> </mobileDevice> <teamsDevice> <local>false</local> <mobile>false</mobile> <teams>true</teams> </teamsDevice> </incomingCallMatrix> <routeHandling>None</routeHandling> </callProfile> <privateData> <requestID>101-null</requestID> </privateData> </GetCallProfileResponse>

searchDocs.title: GetForwarding request​
searchDocs.content: The request asks for the forwarding setup of the user  GetForwarding request <GetForwarding> <device>200</device> <privateData> <requestID>101-null</requestID> </privateData> </GetForwarding>

searchDocs.title: GetForwardingResponse​
searchDocs.content: The response returns the current forwarding setup of the user.  GetForwardingResponse <GetForwardingResponse xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <forwardingList> <forwardListItem> <forwardingType>forwardNoAns</forwardingType> <forwardStatus>false</forwardStatus> <forwardDN>busy</forwardDN> <ringDuration>90</ringDuration> </forwardListItem> </forwardingList> <privateData> <requestID>101-null</requestID> </privateData> </GetForwardingResponse>

searchDocs.title: GetDoNotDisturb request​
searchDocs.content: Requests information on a given queue.  GetQueue request <GetQueue> <device>400</device> <privateData> <requestID>107-null</requestID> </privateData> </GetQueue>

searchDocs.title: GetQueueResponse​
searchDocs.content: Returns the name, SLA and other information on the requested queue.  GetQueueResponse <GetQueueResponse xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <queueDevice> <deviceDescription>Customer Service</deviceDescription> <deviceIdentifier>400</deviceIdentifier> </queueDevice> <privateData> <requestID>101-null</requestID> <serviceLevelAgreement>10</serviceLevelAgreement> </privateData> </GetQueueResponse>

searchDocs.title: GetQueueMember request​
searchDocs.content: Requests information on members of a queue.  GetQueueMember request <GetQueueMember> <device>400</device> <privateData> <requestID>101-null</requestID> </privateData> </GetQueueMember>

searchDocs.title: GetQueueMemberResponse​
searchDocs.content: Returns the members of the requested queue and their membership states.  GetQueueMemberResponse <GetQueueMemberResponse xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <memberList> <memberListItem> <active>true</active> <activeSip>true</activeSip> <activeMobile>false</activeMobile> <activeSkype>false</activeSkype> <agentDN>200</agentDN> </memberListItem> <memberListItem> <active>true</active> <activeSip>true</activeSip> <activeMobile>true</activeMobile> <activeSkype>true</activeSkype> <agentDN>201</agentDN> </memberListItem> </memberList> <privateData> <requestID>101-null</requestID> </privateData> </GetQueueMemberResponse>

searchDocs.title: SetDoNotDisturb request​
searchDocs.content: The DND setting can be updated on a user, by setting the doNotDisturbOn to true/false.  SetDoNotDisturb request <SetDoNotDisturb> <device>200</device> <doNotDisturbOn>true</doNotDisturbOn> <privateData> <requestID>110-1cff5ade-8bd8-469d-94aa-cee257ff247e</requestID> </privateData> </SetDoNotDisturb>

searchDocs.title: SetDoNotDisturbResponse​
searchDocs.content: The response signals that the request has been received by the system.  SetDoNotDisturbResponse <SetDoNotDisturbResponse xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <privateData> <requestID>110-1cff5ade-8bd8-469d-94aa-cee257ff247e</requestID> </privateData> </SetDoNotDisturbResponse>   The event signaling that the change has happened can be found here: DoNotDisturbEvent

searchDocs.title: Signing in​
searchDocs.content: When signing in, the devices set to true will be signed in.  SetQueueMember request <SetQueueMember> <device>400</device> <activateAgent>true</activateAgent> <activateMobile>true</activateMobile> <activateSip>true</activateSip> <activateSkype>true</activateSkype> <agentDN>200</agentDN> <agentPosition>1</agentPosition> <privateData> <requestID>116-d1f7590f-aa6a-4ff7-92c7-b6c3f59eccd1</requestID> </privateData> </SetQueueMember>

searchDocs.title: Signing out​
searchDocs.content: When signing out, the devices should be signed out, but the agent should remain signed in.  SetQueueMember request <SetQueueMember> <device>400</device> <activateAgent>true</activateAgent> <activateMobile>false</activateMobile> <activateSip>false</activateSip> <activateSkype>false</activateSkype> <agentDN>200</agentDN> <agentPosition>1</agentPosition> <privateData> <requestID>116-d1f7590f-aa6a-4ff7-92c7-b6c3f59eccd1</requestID> </privateData> </SetQueueMember>

searchDocs.title: SetQueueMemberResponse​
searchDocs.content: The response signals that the request has been received by the system.  SetQueueMemberResponse <SetQueueMemberResponse xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <privateData> <requestID>116-d1f7590f-aa6a-4ff7-92c7-b6c3f59eccd1</requestID> </privateData> </SetQueueMemberResponse>   The event signaling that the change has happened can be found here: QueueMemberEvent

searchDocs.title: Getting Started​
searchDocs.content: The guides give a quick introduction to CSTA and to our API's.  To connect to the API's however, you need to be a uni-tel customer using the One-Connect product.  Feel free to contact us here. The contact form is in Danish only, but inquiries in English are most welcome.

searchDocs.title: SnapShotDevice request​
searchDocs.content: This requests the current state of a trunk, user or queue.  For trunks the snapshotObject is formatted as such:  SnapShotDevice request for trunk <SnapShotDevice> <snapshotObject>t-12345678</snapshotObject> <privateData> <requestID>101-null</requestID> </privateData> </SnapShotDevice>   For users the snapshotObject is formatted as such:  SnapShotDevice request for user <SnapShotDevice> <snapshotObject>u-12345678-200</snapshotObject> <privateData> <requestID>101-null</requestID> </privateData> </SnapShotDevice>   For queues the snapshotObject is formatted as such:  SnapShotDevice request for queue <SnapShotDevice> <snapshotObject>q-12345678-400</snapshotObject> <privateData> <requestID>101-null</requestID> </privateData> </SnapShotDevice>

searchDocs.title: SetDoNotDisturbResponse​
searchDocs.content: The response returns information on the current state of the requested device or queue.  SetDoNotDisturbResponse <SnapShotDeviceResponse xmlns="http://www.ecma.ch/standards/ecma-323/csta/ed6"> <serviceCrossRefID>u-12345678-200</serviceCrossRefID> <snapshotData> <snapshotDeviceResponseInfo /> </snapshotData> <privateData> <requestID>101-null</requestID> </privateData> </SnapShotDeviceResponse>
